The impermanence of the six sense bases: The eye of the past and future is impermanent, let alone the present.
The ear of the past and future is impermanent, let alone the present.
The nose of the past and future is impermanent, let alone the present.
The tongue of the past and future is impermanent, let alone the present.
The body of the past and future is impermanent, let alone the present.
The mind of the past and future is impermanent, let alone the present.
The practice of a learned noble disciple: They don’t worry about the eye of the past.
They don’t look forward to enjoying the eye in the future.
They practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the eye in the present.
They don’t worry about the mind of the past.
They don’t look forward to enjoying the mind in the future.
They practice for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the mind in the present.
